Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Unnecessary \Un*nec"es*sa*ry\, a. Not necessary; not required under the circumstances; unless; needless; as, unnecessary labor, care, or rigor. -- {Un*nec"es*sa*ri*ly}, adv. -- {Un*nec"es*sa*ri*ness}, n. [1913 Webster]
unnecessarily adv 1: in an unnecessary manner; "they were unnecessarily rude" [ant: {necessarily}] 2: without any necessity; "this marathon would exhaust him unnecessarily"
